content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an example of how you could solve this problem in Julia using regular expressions to identify and remove markdown syntax for code blocks:
```julia
using RegularExpressions

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Find all julia code blocks
    matches = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)```", md, capture=2))
    
    if isempty(matches)  # No julia code found
        return ""
    elseif length(matches) == 1  # Only one block of julia code
        return matches[1]
    else
        # Join all matches with newline, remove code fences and then join the result with a newline
        return join(join.(matches), "\n") * "\n"
    end
end
```
This function will find all blocks of julia code in your markdown document, concatenate them together, and remove the code fences. If there is only one block of julia code, it will simply return that block as a string.
